Package ohos.agp.render.opengl

Provides Embedded-System Graphics Library (EGL) and OpenGL for Embedded Systems (OpenGL ES) interfaces.

EGL interfaces are used between the OpenGL ES and underlying window systems. You can use these interfaces to obtain the underlying configuration and information about the EGL display device, create EGLSurface and EGLContext objects, and associate the created objects. Then, you can call the specific rendering interfaces to draw your desired content and save the content on the EGLSurface. Finally, you call EGL.eglSwapBuffers(EGLDisplay, EGLSurface) to display the content on the screen.

For more information, please visit EGL and OpenGL ES.

Since:
3
